intro: Tryphane, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It consists of several species, many of which are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plants are typically shrubs or herbs with hairy stems and showy, often pink or red, flowers. They produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Tryphane species are adapted to rocky and dry environments, making them resilient to harsh conditions.
